actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Census and Population.
Mr. Ackerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Mr. Ridge demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 387.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 1196 proposed by Senator Kohl for Senator Glenn.
Amendment SP 1196 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Mr. Sawyer moved that the House agree to the Senate amendment.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-227.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: Extending the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to conduct the quarterly financial report program under section 91 of title 13, United States Code, through September 30, 1993.

summary.text: Extends the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to collect and publish quarterly business financial statistics through September 30, 1993. Provides for partial deferred payments of lump-sum credit according to a specified payment schedule for certain individuals electing alternative forms of civil service annuities if the commencement date of the annuity falls between December 2, 1989, and October 1, 1990. Increases the limitations on the borrowing authority of the U.S. Postal Service.

titles.title: Extending the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to conduct the quarterly financial report program under section 91 of title 13, United States Code, through September 30, 1993.
